page.title: 17A COUNTRY WALK
page.content: Stratford-on-Avon country walk . On Wednesday, 19th June, 1985, we went for a walk to Orchard Hill Farm.The farmer showed us the place where they kept Wellington Bombers a long time ago.It was a tarmac track and the bombers were kept there during the last world war.The farmer also showed us a field which had oil seed rape growing in it and he thought the Romans had built a fort.It was a very good place to have it because you could see all over the fields and the River Stour.On the way back we saw the disused railway.You could even see the tracks where it had been built.They were very_ faint but we could still see them.We also saw an old bridge which the trains used to go under.Stephanie Pilbeam.9 years old.
